snippet: In Maine, an end to years of rancor and uncertainty will eliminate impediments to a variety of fish including salmon, shad and alewives.
abstract: Workers begin removing the Great Works Dam in Maine in the first step to restoring a more natural flow of the Penobscot River, which saw its once-abundant runs of fish wiped out after the dam impeded migrations to fish spawning grounds; long-delayed start of the project is expected to end years of rancor and uncertainty.
lead_paragraph: In Maine, an end to years of rancor and uncertainty will eliminate impediments to a variety of fish including salmon, shad and alewives.

headline.seo: Maine Dam Removal a Start to Restoring Spawning Grounds
headline.main: Dam Removal to Help Restore Spawning Grounds
headline.print_headline: Dam Removal to Help Restore Spawning Grounds
